title: Woman is dragged into a 4x4 by a man wearing a hi viz shirt in Logan, Queensland
text:
The horrifying moment a woman is dragged into a car by a man wearing an orange hi-vis shirt has been captured on camera.

The alleged victim was seen lying on the grass in front of a black 4x4 on Browns Plains Rd in Logan, Queensland, about 6am on Tuesday.

In a series of pictures shared to the Crime Watch Logan Facebook page, the man appears to pull the woman from the ground and into the car.

The alleged victim was seen lying on the ground in front of a black 4x4 on Browns Plains Rd in Logan, Queensland, about 6am on Tuesday. In a series of pictures shared to the Crime Watch Logan Facebook page, the man appears to pull the woman into the car

'From what I see, the female was lying on the footpath trying to get away and fighting back against the male forcefully dragging her to the car,' the Facebook post said.

'He then lifts her once, throwing her into the back seat.

'It even appears he's dragging her by her long hair.'

The Facebook post was flooded with concerned comments and many asking if the alleged altercation was reported to police.

'I hope she is okay and I'm glad she has evidence,' one person said.

Crime Watch Logan said the person who observed the incident reported it to police.

Queensland Police told Daily Mail Australia they are aware of the incident.

'It is a DV related matter involving two people known to each other,' a spokeswoman said, referencing domestic violence.

'The woman is safe and police apprehended the man and are taking all necessary police action.

'No further information can be released as this is a DV incident.'

authors: Zoe Zaczek For Daily Mail Australia
